website_summaries.verdict: A wide range of grain-free dry dog food formulas to suit dogs with sensitivities to grains or dogs who need extra protein.
pros: Includes LifeSource Bits for extra vitamins and nutrients
Different kibble sizes for toy through large breeds
cons: Some owners claimed their dogs developed diarrhea after eating this food

customer_reviews.title: Has gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: Been feeding my dogs Blue Buffalo for three years. Everything was good until a month ago when both of my dogs started having stool problems. One of them had really bad diarrhea and would wake me up 3-5 times at night to go outside. I thought it wasn’t food related so I fed them home cooked food and they stopped having diarrhea. I switched them back on Blue Buffalo and the diarrhea is back. We saw a lot of similar recent reviews on consumer affairs about dogs getting very sick after eating BB since General Mills has bought it. I’m not buying BB anymore. For the price of it you’d expect to get a good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: F2010

customer_reviews.title: Sick dog!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a Blue Buffalo customer since I got my dog a year ago. Last week I opened up a new bag of the food she always eats. 3 days later she was vomiting everywhere extremely lethargic and began refusing to eat her BB food for the next 4 days. I took her to the vet today to find out that it was the food she was avoiding and that there have been other dogs that have gotten sick with this new formula due to high lead levels! Please check the reviews before purchasing!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Bystry

customer_reviews.title: Don’t try without researching
customer_reviews.text: Dog was attracted to flavor but had constant loose bowels even after gradually integrating it into her diet. Female Maltese Yorker mix 11 LB
customer_reviews.author: J Jaeckle

customer_reviews.title: Recommend to those that deal pitbull allergies
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using blue buffalo for the past month now and already see a huge difference in my dogs skin and hair. he’s no longer scratching at himself or breaking out. When I was using pedigree the photo on the left was what happening to his skin/hair falling out and hot spots. The photo on the right is after switching blue buffalo for his diet. He’s much happier as well his skin and hair looks million times better 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog Sickness from New Recipie
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been buying Blue Wilderness Chicken for my dog ever since I switched him to adult food. He used to love the dog food but the latest bag I bought had noticeably larger kibble bits. I am not sure if they have changed the recipie but my dog would have consistent diarrhea and vomiting. I have since stopped ordering Blue Wilderness. I do not advise buying this product until they return to their original recipie.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Ng

customer_reviews.title: I switched him and my cats to Merrick and his breathing is getting better and his awful cough is finally going away
customer_reviews.text: I was a Blue Wilderness supporter for years but the company went down the toilet. They outsource their protein and it's making our pets sick! My dog became lethargic and developed a breathing problem. I switched him and my cats to Merrick and his breathing is getting better and his awful cough is finally going away. Shame on you Blue Wilderness for providing toxins for our adored pets!
customer_reviews.author: Sigie0624

customer_reviews.title: Blue Mountain Grain-Free Duck Dog Food is the best!!
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 year old Border Aussie Finn LOVES Blue Mountain Grain-Free Duck Dog Food, as well as the Duck Treats!! He just had his 3 y/o physical, and is in great shape, sleek and muscular, and all chemical values are healthy! One caveat though, is that our vet indicates that recent research shows that grain free dog food eventually leads to cardiac issues (cardiomegaly/enlarged heart) and suggested adding Nutro Dog Food to his meals. Finn needs to lose 5 pounds, so hopefully this addition will help. We alternate a bowl of BM Duck Dog Kibble with a bowl of adult Nutro Dog Food. Finn enjoys both foods!
customer_reviews.author: Eilid Sidhe

customer_reviews.title: Happy dog begging me to fill her dog in pic ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the only product my very picky and spoiled pittie, Winnie, eats! When I adopted her, I was informed of her high intolerance to grains and grain by-products. I was purchasing it from an upscale neighborhood pet store, until I found out it was much more affordable on Amazon. Both she and I are thrilled about it! Happy dog begging me to fill her bowl in pic below:
customer_reviews.author: LBurtie1981

customer_reviews.title: MOLD IN DOG FOOD!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ALWAYS buy this brand and I usually just repeat my oder once my dog's food is close to finishing. Yesterday we we're nearing the end of his latest food bag and this blob of dog food mold (see photos) fell out of the bottom of the bag!!! My dog has been sick on and off for the past month (since we received his latest food bag) and we could not figure out what was causing the issue until now! I usually love this brand, but after seeing this, I DO NOT RECOMMEND this food bag anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Melina

customer_reviews.title: Making my dog sick!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure where this product comes from but my dog has eaten Blue Buffalo for years with no issues. However the last bag I bought on Amazon gave her diarrhea and made her throw up.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Be Careful on the product
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding my dog for years their food. it seems that the salmon cost me 434$ at the vet per the VCA vet. I still have a bag of the chicken and I will see how that goes. the is the 2nd large vet bill in the last 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: damiboo

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I have used Blue in the past, this exact one and never had a problem. Upon switching back to this, my bulldog- who will eat anything, refuses to touch this food. And when he does, it makes him violently ill. I thought maybe he had a bug or his stomach had to adjust back to the food but after a couple weeks, it’s still a problem & I stopped feeding him it. There were days where he wouldn’t even go near his bowl and I’d have to give him eggs or something else just so he’d eat. Stay away. After reading the reviews, it’s not worth it. Save your dog...and your money.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Change in quality
customer_reviews.text: Ever since General Mills purchased Blue dog food, it has been down hill. The last bag, the kibble size has changed and the odor is almost repulsive, so they change what was a good product for the sake of greed. We contacted them and of course they denied any change, but I have proof in the bag it has changed. We purchased this product from Chewy and to their credit, they sent a free replacement, but it is not any better. After using this for years, I am forced to change for my pet's safety.
customer_reviews.author: K. K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: We have been buying BB for a long time, we recently (slowly) switched to the duck. DO NOT DO IT! Both German Shepherds began to get skin lesions and scruffy fur. They refused to eat the food after a few days. I don't know if we got a bad batch, but I will not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: GuitarSkater

customer_reviews.title: Buggy Food
customer_reviews.text: At the bottom of the bag was a web like substance with worms crawling around it. I called the vet and he said they were not harmful to the dogs. It was horrifying.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Rivas Huba

customer_reviews.title: Consult your vet @ grain free
customer_reviews.text: I have purchase Blue Buffalo for years but My vet just informed me that “grain free” is proving to be very unhealthy for dogs. Research shows increase in heart disease. Too much fat in this, and other grain free foods. Ask your vet.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M.

customer_reviews.title: No more chicken allergy scratching!
customer_reviews.text: My poor puppy for over a year was suffering with his ears shakes and scratching of his ears, not so bad that we thought it was a huge problem but we always noticed it and would always try to figure out what it was. The vet said it could be chicken allergies. So this is the first time trying a non-chicken-based food. And that’s what it was ! NO MORE EAR SCRATCHES! My two dogs are up SAST with this food. They cannot wait to eat it. The price is good especially if you get the largest size. It is a bit pinker do you to the fish product
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: What can I say.
customer_reviews.text: Product might be fantastic I don't know because I don't eat it. Problem was my dog wasn't to keen on it either and she developed a rash under her arm pits. Have no clue as to whether the change in diet caused the rash only know that when we started with this food her rash appeared and when we stopped it went away. I guess that can happen to people having issues with certain foods.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie K

customer_reviews.title: They changed ingredients and now it makes all 3 of my farm dogs sick!
customer_reviews.text: I switched to this food along time ago under the pretense that it had the best ingredients. After spending thousands of dollars chasing what turns out to be a food allergy in my 12 year old German shepherd I figured it out! Blue Buffalo has switched ingredients and all 3 if my dogs have issues but my 12 year old almost got put down it's so bad. We stopped feeding him Blue Baffalo and he immediate improved. I'm very angry because I feel like they baited and switched. I have 3 dogs and used to feed 3 bags a month.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful experience. Read ingredients thoroughly.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my hound dog. I had her on basic but she was breaking out with hives from bag to bag. She is very sensitive to chicken. I bought this thinking oh its just salmon. Which is perfect. I did not read the ingredients. Its mostly chicken meal. So after eating a bowl. She swelled up. I thought she was gonna die. I threw this stuff away. It was a waste of money and a bad experience. They should put with chicken on the front also. I buy core now. 100% chicken and grain free. She is so much healthier getting her off of basic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No more
customer_reviews.text: My dog ate Blue Buffalo Lamb and Rice for several years and recently refused to eat it, so I switched her to Blue Wilderness. Nothing like paying premium prices and throwing away better than 1/2 of the 30 pound bag. Since my dog is food motivated animal I have to presume that Blue Buffalo has changed something in either their product suppliers or manufacturing process. Too expensive to keep buying and throwing away. Sorry Blue, you've lost a customer.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Legett

customer_reviews.title: My review can only be how my 9 year old Yorkshire Terrier Responded to The Food
customer_reviews.text: You can look at my order to see the date delivered and note that was the day I filled her bowl with this product. Today is 3/11/2020 and only a few pieces are missing. She ate those few pieces, walked away and to this date not returned. However we have fed her other brands and that was consumed. CONCLUSION: SHE DOES NOT LIKE YOUR PRODUCT. I am reluctant to throw the bag out to the squirrels. Can I get a refund, because this ain't no cheap stuff!!!
customer_reviews.author: NASA GEMINI TEAM

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I expected from years past.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs loved this brand for years, however they wouldn’t touch this particular bag of food. After wrestling with them and trying to get them to eat it for days now I finally gave up and have tossed it. Have now read other reviews of online orders, wish I’d read them first... What is going on here? Buyer beware?
customer_reviews.author: klaz

customer_reviews.title: Choking Danger- IRRESPONSIBLE MANUFACTURER
customer_reviews.text: In the last package I received, we found a couple of almost 3 IncH "unprocessed" kibble. I noticed when my dog was choking and throwing up the food. I contacted the manufacturer and they basically told me to go pound sand. They said that if I feel there's a problem with the food, I should just ask Amazon for a refund. They took absolutely no responsibility for the product nor the quality. They don't care if your pet chokes and dies. *****IF YOU LOVE YOUR PETS,DON'T BUY THIS BRAND*******
customer_reviews.author: 14thor

customer_reviews.title: The Best dog food.
customer_reviews.text: We biy BB Salmon once a month for our dog. She has had stomach issues as a puppy ( almost died from a previous food) we started her on BB shortly after that and she has been perfect for the past 4 years. We did try to put her on a more expensive brand and she wanted nothing to do with it. We would definitely recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Davis

customer_reviews.title: The dog loved this, but we can't really afford it unless it's on sale
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to agree well with our Border collie/Spaniel cross. The dog gets tons of exercise: a lot of 8-10 mile walks and many uphill and beach adventures. He loves, loves, loves to play with other dogs, even after one of his big walks. The kibble is mixed in with his raw chicken, raw beef, steamed veggies and salmon oil. He took to the kibble right away, so we recommend it. Too bad about the high price.
customer_reviews.author: @your6Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: enjoyment by my baby- Daisy
customer_reviews.text: My baby, Daisy, was putting on a few more pounds than my vet approved of RE: eating the highly rated commercial brands, i.e. Purina, Pedigree, Alpo. Finally after purchasing Wilderness Chicken Jerky as a treat and she LOVES it, we reviewed ingredients and caloric differences, we decided to try Wilderness High Protein Chicken (she LOVES chicken). It has been the best for our girl. She eats it like there's no tomorrow and is now down to an weight that the vet is happy with. She is not starving and love dinner time along with the treats in between. Will keep this on our list forever, because she is our FOREVER BABY.
customer_reviews.author: Carlene

customer_reviews.title: Great food
customer_reviews.text: I have had my dogs on this wilderness Blue Buffalo line of food since puppies. Been 6 years and 4 dogs now. They've gone from the puppy version, to the regular version, to the weight management version, back to the normal. All of the flavors. Never had any issues. They love it and it's clean food. Every stomach issue they've had has been attributed to an outside factor. Dogs get into stuff. Dogs can get animal flues and colds just like humans when they're running around getting into stuff. I mix some fresh cooked rice into their food (1-1 ratio) and it clears it right up every time within a day.
customer_reviews.author: K. Sizemore

customer_reviews.title: Only food my dog can eat!
customer_reviews.text: We got our dog when he was 3 months old. We have tried different types of food but everything just kept upsetting his stomach and ended up giving him IBS this is the ONLY food that he can eat that will not cause him to have diarrhea or throw up. I love that is doesn't have byproducts and it also is high in protein. It's also the only food that is safe for my sickly cat. While my cats do have their own food and their own dish they love to steal the little protein pieces out of the dog food (which my 95 pound dog allows them to do).
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Suess

customer_reviews.title: AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: Switching from puppy to adult food I decided to try this food. I should have read the reviews. My guy absolutely LOVED this food and but within days the diarrhea and gas started. It was really bad. I thought it couldn't be the food, but we stopped the food and it went away. I was really bummed because the other food he doesn't like as much but has no bowel problems. Not sure what happened to BB but I would avoid!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did the dog eat it? Meh
customer_reviews.text: After much research, I bought a bag. I can't comment on the favor but it has a strong barbecue smell. She seemed to be getting indigestion as a lot of grass was being consumed after eating. My dog won't eat this food without something added: carrots, chicken, or another dog food (Purina Bella mixed half and half. This is a small kibble like the Bells). She's a lab and tries everything but clearly lets me know when she is not crazy about a product.
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick on first bowl...threw out
customer_reviews.text: My dog has a steel stomach and has never thrown up....Until her first bowl of this....I made the mistake of seeing all the stars in the review and didnt read. Threw the bag into the garbage.... don't know of it was due to late delivery from Amazon but based on other reviews it was worth the risk of my dogs life...
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Recent order led to bloody diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: Been feeding Blue Buffalo to my dog since she was a pup with 0 issued. Purchased from this seller a few weeks ago and opened the bag this week. Dog immediatey developed bloody diarrhea. Discontinued food and put on bland diet, symptoms subsided, reintroduced Blue Wilderness into diet and wet bloody diarrhea returned. Seller sent replacement bag at no charge however, if Vet determines food is the cause, Blue Wilderness will be hearing from us to cover those costs. Extremely disappointed in quality. Not ok.
customer_reviews.author: Ana P.

customer_reviews.title: I'm unsure
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding my dogs blue buffalo for a couple years now. They always loved it and I loved it. I've been hearing a lot about lawsuits and issues with them, though, and it makes me nervous. I haven't had any issues in that regard, but I'm noticing my dogs have had recurring ear infections and recurring anal gland issues and I'm wondering if this food is causing an allergic reaction. We have our lab on an allergy food because she clearly has allergies and I'm thinking about switching my shepherd to something else, too. The food has come in good condition time after time, though, so I'm not really sure how to feel about it.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Not my favorite
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried many different Blue Buffalo flavors and this is my least favorite because of the smell. My dog loves it just as much as he loves the chicken and beef flavors so if it were up to him he’d give this five stars but the smell is repugnant to me. I suppose that if you like the smell of duck you wouldn’t mind this as much, but I have to hold my breath when I open the airtight container where we store his food. I also feel that his stool has taken on the smell of the food too. Won’t buy again but still giving this 4/5 stars because I realize it’s just a personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: MeThinks

customer_reviews.title: Made my yorkies sick. Bad food.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs became sick shortly after I gave them this food. My vet said “let me guess what food you’re using......blue buffalo” He said it has a huge fat content and the pancreas of most dogs is unable to filter, making them sick. It is not worth it for the GI distress it causes. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: slferde

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves this....
customer_reviews.text: I have a lab retriever mix. He has skin allergies and a sensitive tummy. The ONLY food I've found that allows him to grow hair back on legs and underside is Blue Buffalo = usually the Bison wilderness type. However, he likes variety so I tried this flavor and he really likes it. I also feed him green beans and veggies at dinner time to augment the high protein formula of BB. He is quite healthy and happy with this food.
customer_reviews.author: Jewelry Lover

customer_reviews.title: Dog Sick
customer_reviews.text: My dog wouldn’t stop puking up her food. So, I went and bought a new bag from the local pet store. Turns out I got a rotten bag. She kept down the food from the new bag. Canceled subscription...
customer_reviews.author: Adam S.

customer_reviews.title: The Bag of Dog food was delivered open
customer_reviews.text: The box was delivered to my residence with ants crawling all over the out side. When I open the box the bag had been cut at the top. It appears the it may have been cut with a box cutter. The cut was approximately 2-3 inches and ants were crawling in and out of the bag.. With in a few minutes I had ants all over my arms and neck. There was dog food spread through the inside of the box as well. Needless t say I had to through out the dog food. I would like a refund or another bag.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CAUSES LIVER DAMAGE
customer_reviews.text: Warning to dog parents: this causes liver damage!!! We had our lab on this for three years and took her for her annual check up yesterday where the vet said her liver is damaged. They asked what food we feed her and when we said BB, they immediately said we need to switch food and get our baby on medication. I hope the damage is not permanent. Please please do not risk giving your dog this brand. We used to be loyal to BB but not anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Basic dog food, great marketing
customer_reviews.text: My Chesapeake Bay Retriever ranks this food at the bottom of all edible things in the house. Even when finally eating it, she is still hungry and roaming for food. The marketing is great (cool lifestyle images and foil shining bags), but even the vet has told me to steer clear as this is like the McDonalds of dog food. I have switched to Royal Canin labrador food and my dog likes it and is satisfied/filled by it. This food is edible and will keep a dog alive, but I certainly felt more excited about this purchase than my dog did.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W.

customer_reviews.title: Best for our dog's fur coat
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is an albino Pekingese (he's a rescue) and he used to get sooo many hot spots on his sensitive skin - until we found this food. Although I wish it were more affordable (hence the 3-star rating for the value), I am still giving it overall five stars because I believe the salmon part of the food has been really good for him. I mix it with water because he's older so it's easier on his teeth. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Angela Cruz

customer_reviews.text: We have 2 australian shepherds and they love this food and one of them has a sensitive stomach, this doesn't give her any problems! Highly recommend, good quality food. I wish it was a little less expensive but you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Kuwabara Family

customer_reviews.title: My dog will actually eat this.
customer_reviews.text: My little Toy Poodle is quite fussy about her food but she really likes this dry food. The only drawback on this package is that it is not resealable so I had to put it in containers that actually did reseal.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Lundy

customer_reviews.title: My pet love this
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a replacement dog food for my maltese poodle mix. I used to give him a different brand but noticed that it has some side effects for him. After finishing a whole bag which took my pet about 2 months, i can say this is a better brand for him. He is now 5 years old so maybe changing diets is becoming more important thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey H.

customer_reviews.title: Read FDA reports!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to throw this out due to the FDA findings.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie S

customer_reviews.title: Blue Buffalo needs to look at their grain free formulas.
customer_reviews.text: My dog has been on this formula for years! But there is a growing concern among veterinarians that dogs on a grain free diet may be at risk for a heart problem. There has been a rise in the number of dogs developing this heart condition outside the typical breeds that do. Love my 15 year old canine of hybrid vigor. Not taking chances. Now ..... I am switching to a Blue Buffalo chicken and rice senior formula.
customer_reviews.author: Janet M Downs

customer_reviews.title: Rosie enjoys it twice a day
customer_reviews.text: My lab mix makes fast work of her cup morning and night. A cup of kefir and a raw egg round out her meals. No complaints from Rosie, and she's a great pooper.
customer_reviews.author: Zsa Zsu Pitts

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: This made my dog very sick. Please be careful and buy this particular brand in the store.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Moldy food
customer_reviews.text: We had this on auto ship and didn’t need to open it for the past month, and when I went to refill our bin the dog food was full of moldy pieces through the entire bag. The bag was in tact and doesn’t expire until Dec 2020 so this definitely should not have happened. Terrible quality. Now I have to run to the pet store tomorrow morning or my dog won’t get breakfast.
customer_reviews.author: acava14

customer_reviews.title: Destiny Hope APPROVES!!
customer_reviews.text: Destiny Hope most definitely APPROVES!!! Sadly, since her “hysterectomy”, she just has to smell good food & she gains weight, but, her Vet, Dr Madison said she could have 1/4 cup of her Salmon food every day or every other day as it is very good for her hair, skin, & joints. The rest of her meals MUST be her BLUE BUFFALO HEALTHY WEIGHT CHICKEN OR BEEF....🥰🥰
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Was good - now dog sick
customer_reviews.text: 70lb Yellow Lab used to love this food. She has recently started to throw up 3-4 hours after consuming. This has been happening for 5-6 months. After reading other reviews I realize I am not the only one. I would recommend you checking out manufacturers prior to having your pet consuming. Not worth the savings from subscribe and save. Cancelled and will not be reordering due to 8 year old pets sickness/GI Issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Sherwin

customer_reviews.title: Our 10 year old dogs appears to really like this dog food.
customer_reviews.text: Our dog has been on Science Diet Prescription for the past 4 months, and she hated it. We talked to our vet, and he agreed that maybe she should change back to Blue Buffalo. We just received this and she finished an entire serving, which is very unusual for our dog, in five minutes. That tells me that she really like it.
customer_reviews.author: T. D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Amazon workout the shipping, please!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using blue for years for my cats and dog. This more of a warning. Automation isn’t alway great amazon. Two separate orders made on different days ended up in the same box. Needless to say I won’t be feeding my dog this bag of food. The Clorox got all over the dog food bag.
customer_reviews.author: chiquitanerd

customer_reviews.title: amazing
customer_reviews.text: i got this in small pacers at petsmart as samples for my 3 year old white german shepard and 20 year old chihuahua. they usually sniff their food then walk away and eat it later because it’s the only thing for them, but this food they smelt it and IMMEDIATLY started eating it. i seriously was shocked they only do that for wet foods. i decided to invest $50 is nothing for 2 happy dogs i’m very happy
customer_reviews.author: salma

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY CUSTOMER!!!  Here, you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: Blue wilderness has turned my dog's health around. He always had stomach issues and diarrhea before we switched him off the Costco store brand and onto this. now he has filled out (in a good way) and his coat is shiny and we run a LOT...I can tell a HUGE difference in his stamina.
customer_reviews.author: usafpilotmamaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: great dog kibble
customer_reviews.text: great dog food. our allergic to everything frenchie loves this stuff. it’s the only one that doesn’t make her break out. consistent quality and fast shipping with prime
customer_reviews.author: Stevie

customer_reviews.title: Why do the drivers never ring the door bell?
customer_reviews.text: We love the product always have. Its just the delivery drivers never ring or knock. When they put the package up against the door, it blocks my mom (who I order for) from opening her screen door and she is elderly. She cant even pick up by box! Her dog only eats this stuff and much cheaper to order it. The driver wont take away from the review, but damn.
customer_reviews.author: Ziencora Sun

customer_reviews.title: Great food, but those annoying "petrified rocks" are a pain
customer_reviews.text: Our 2 dogs love the food kibbles , but turn there noses up at the stone-hard "nutritional pellets" that are interlaced in all the Blue Buffalo products. These tiny pellets are like small petrified rocks and I've been surprised neither of the dogs have broken a tooth trying to pick them out...they usually end up on the carpet or left in the bowl. HARD FOOD, 5 stars... NUISANCE PELLETS 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: David Espersen

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Had such high hopes for this food as it's rating seemed to be so very good, I looked at many products. My boxer will only eat this if I mix it with chunks of boiled chicken and chicken broth. Glad I only purchased smaller bag.
customer_reviews.author: Frequent customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog ate the "Big" bits only
customer_reviews.text: I have a terrier and he seemed to really like this food except for one thing. The food chunks come in two sizes: small and large. I believe they must have different tastes as he scatters the small ones around the floor as he seeks out the big ones to eat. Makes quite a mess. Won't buy again because he wastes about 1/2 the food.
customer_reviews.author: patty

customer_reviews.title: My dog’s favorite
customer_reviews.text: I mix this with the regular Blue Buffalo Adult food. My dog loves it. My previous Golden Retriever died of cancer at 8 1/2 years old. When I got a Golden mix, I wanted to be more careful of what I fed her. My son recommended Blue Buffalo and I started her on Blue Buffalo from the very beginning. She is now almost 9 years old and is doing well on Blue Buffalo food and snacks.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette

customer_reviews.title: Okay quality too expensive
customer_reviews.text: You saved money on this product with subscribe and Save. It's a fairly decent product. But it does cause really smelly stools. The dogs enjoy the food just fine. I have five dogs. I will not be reordering it to subscribe and Save oh, it's just too expensive and they keep changing the price.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Sick German Shepherds
customer_reviews.text: My GSDs got very sick from eating this food. Cost me emergency vet, lost day at work, and another vet visit. And 2+ weeks of recovery for my dogs. Never again!
customer_reviews.author: RAE

customer_reviews.title: High quality treat with consistent texture.
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this limited ingredient product. It does not upset my dog’s stomach and arrives fairly consistently baked where other treats often arrive over-baked and too hard. I can easily break these treats in half and my dog still gets a decent sized reward so I’m able to better control his calories while rewarding him more! I never run out of these and would buy larger sized bags if offered.
customer_reviews.author: TLW

customer_reviews.title: It also smells really bad. We have are trying different food typed because ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried the duck for my dog because she has allergies, we always bought the red meat dry food from blue wilderness. On the second day she was on this new flavor she started getting diarrhea, by the 5th day vomiting. We changed nothing but the flavor. It also smells really bad. We have are trying different food typed because of her allergies and I don't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: nan lapuma

customer_reviews.title: Lots of dog farts
customer_reviews.text: I was not impressed. I don’t think my dog liked it that much. When I switched, she liked the other food much better. She had constant dog farts with this. Was happy to switch. Also, vet informed me that some dogs are having problems with all protein diets. You for ones dropping dead of massive heArt attacks. Also too much protein and skin gets itchy. A little grain is good for them if they aren’t allergic.
customer_reviews.author: amy ritchie

customer_reviews.title: Great for our Huskies
customer_reviews.text: Our huskies love this food and it does very well in keeping them healthy with a good coat. One of the better dog-food brands available I'm a huge fan of the Blue Buffalo products. Pricing is very similar to other competitors and with auto-ship or prime having it show up at your front door is a major bonus. Our dogs are high-energy dogs who get lots of exercise and with the Blue Buffalo products we've never had issues with regularity or digestion. I recommend these products to anyone who has a dog.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy K.

customer_reviews.title: No more 4am wake up calls.  I get to sleep again!
customer_reviews.text: My yorkie was itching like crazy eating Rachel Ray Nutrish. He was constantly waking up thru the night scratching and crying. After ONE feeding of this he slept like a rock and on the floor, where he belongs. Combined this withso I'm not sure which is more responsible for the new sleeping and lack of itching, but either way I'd pay double for these products if this keeps up.
customer_reviews.author: Zczek

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous- don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: We had our labradoodle on this for awhile and he would throw up on a regular basis. After reading the negative news about Blue Buffalo, we immediately switched back to Nutro Lamb and Rice large breed. He has stopped throwing up. I would like to know how to become part of the current class action lawsuit. This is infuriating!!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Good food just not for us
customer_reviews.text: I liked this food a lot but it didn't agree with my dog. She developed urinary problems which our veterinarian said could be because of the high protein content of the food. We have switched to the Blue regular diet and she's doing great. This diet along with pumpkin treats helped her anal gland issues just for the record and for anyone else who might be having issues of the same kind.
customer_reviews.author: R. SineTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Shady
customer_reviews.text: Something shady has happened, my dogs loved this food for years. The last 2 bags we’ve received the dogs won’t eat it. They will let it sit in their bowls for all day, once my pit finally broke down and ate, he threw it all up about 30 minutes later
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good food for my dog.
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this stuff. It doesn’t upset her stomach and I feel that she gets good nutrition without unnecessary fillers. My dog is an 8 year old Australian Shepherd/Blue Heeler mix with a lot of energy to burn. I’m happy she does well on this food, and she’s worth the extra expense.
customer_reviews.author: Dhs

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it. Cleared up her dandruff.
customer_reviews.text: I recently tried this for the first time. I was a bit hesitant because I think the price is a bit higher than the other big name grocery store brands. My dog loves it and it actually cleared up her dandruff in a little over a week! It must be the ingredients but I plan to continue to purchase this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny B

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Nutritional Value
customer_reviews.text: Started my dog on this brand due to his nutritional and dietary needs. He will eat this brand of dry food even though he was given mainly “people food” by his former owner.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Latest batch making dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: Dogs started getting sick into this latest bag. It appears that the quality has not improved after settling law suits for lead and misleading the public about ingredients. Time for a change of food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: If you read the ingredients it is the best dog food for your dog. What a difference in my dogs coat, eyes, etc. I just wish the price was easier to handle. Very expensive and rarely ever on a great sale.
customer_reviews.author: Verny

customer_reviews.title: My dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: But then again my dog just ate three dead birds the other day too. But the flip side, they are also healthy and having far less gastric issues than other dog foods. Still its a bit pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: The best dog food!
customer_reviews.text: Our labrador had an awful allergy. She would get an itchy face and rub it all over the walls until her face bled. We tried benedryl at our vet's advice, and it didn't really help. I did research and found out it could be a grain allergy. After I switched to this product our dog stopped rubbing her face raw. Both of our dogs seem to think it's delicious, too. Well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: David and Tara

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick.
customer_reviews.text: Awful. After reading the comments, I think it is a good idea to remove Blue Buffalo products from your site.
customer_reviews.author: Janice DiCiuccio

customer_reviews.title: Caused an allergy reaction and redness from the paws.
customer_reviews.text: The second order of wildness high protein caused an allergy from my dog. His paws were returned red and he started to lick them 2-3 hours after having his meal of this product as matter I observed for the pattern. However, he had no such issue from the last order.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wang

customer_reviews.title: Great for dog coats
customer_reviews.text: My chocolate lab had problems with his coat and when we started to feed him this his coat improved drastically! It was shinier and thicker. However, my pit bull seemed to have problems when we fed her this. She was constantly going to the bathroom.
customer_reviews.author: Xana

customer_reviews.title: Great Food for a Great Friend
customer_reviews.text: Product has been well liked by my Australian Shepherd until this last bag. Not sure if it the dog food or the dog. Today she walked up to the bowl and sniffed it and just walked away. As I said, very good food for her until this bag. May look at starting to mix in some different food from Blue Buffalo to switch over to different flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Smith

customer_reviews.title: I was not very pleased with this
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this food, however this last delivery arrived with one bag completely separated at the seam on one side. The box was full of loose dog food. I was not very pleased with this. Not sure how it happened. Doesn't look torn, just split right down the front seam on one side. I plan to continue ordering, but maybe I have to do just one bag at a time like I used to instead of 2.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Dead rodent in my pet food bag
customer_reviews.text: Upon open this bag of food and pouring it into the plastic container I store the food in a dead mouse fell out of the bag. I should have taken a picture but do to my fie year olds fear of mice the first thing that came to mind was to get it out of the house and into the trash. I hope we can resolve this issue in a timely fashion and I thank you in advnce for your cooperation on this matter. Sincerely Michael Volkert. Mecaveman192@aol.com
customer_reviews.author: michael v.

customer_reviews.title: Not blaming the food, but dog now has urinary problems.
customer_reviews.text: About a year into this food, he developed a UTI and "bladder crystals." Not blaming the food, but as my vet said "anyone can make dog food these days. Rachael Ray, you name it!" My vet's advice, stick to Purina or Hill's Science brands as they are careful what ingredients they use.
customer_reviews.author: Macy

customer_reviews.title: Gave my dog allergy symptoms - both recipes
customer_reviews.text: There’s something about this recipe that isn’t right. I tried both the red meat blend and the bird game blend. Both gave my dog flare ups which has never happened with other foods.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Schmaltz

customer_reviews.title: My picky dog eats without a fuss.
customer_reviews.text: This doggy food is great. I have the pickiest Shih Tzu anyone ever had and she loves this kibble. I just put the proper portion in her bowl and she goes for it. THANK YOU Blue Buffalo,Wilderness. I should add she really loves duck which is hard to find in dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Talia

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I fed this food to my dogs for three Months. I took my two-year-old dog to the vet today for a normal check up. He had gained 12 pounds since he was there for an allergic reaction three months ago. His activity level has not changed. She strongly recommended not feeding this food or any grain free food that uses peas and legumes for the filler because they are causing deaths due to heart disease. Beware
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Hill

customer_reviews.title: Quality and appeal for the dogs.
customer_reviews.text: This is a brand I have purchased in past and there was no problem. After trial and error, I discovered by a process of elimination it was this dry dog food they wouldn't eat. Something is very wrong with this batch. These pups are not finicky eaters so you have a big problem. Don't sell it to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: S.. Dooley

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE OF THIS PRODUCT!! MADE MY DOG SICK
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been feeding my dog blue buffalo wilderness since she’s been a puppy and she absolutely loves it. I usually buy it from petco or petsmart, but decided to get it off amazon because it was cheaper. After feeding her the one I bought from amazon she started getting sick and throwing up. After a while she wouldn’t even touch her food. So I decided to go to petco and buy her a new bag. I compared the food and IT IS NOT THE SAME. The kibbles look different and the food even smells different. I would not recommend buying this product from amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Depends the dog I guess
customer_reviews.text: The value for money is good if your dog can eat it without issue. My dog could for a few months before he started having adverse reactions to it. I started cooking for my dog and he has more energy and visibly in higher spirits.
customer_reviews.author: X. Laster

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with this food!
customer_reviews.text: I feed this to my English Bulldog. When we adopted her, she had hotspots ALL OVER HER. :( After feeding her this food, her spots started healing up. We have fed this to her ever since and she has such a BEAUTIFUL and shiny coat. She isn't having any allergy issues with it AT ALL. We now have a Miniature Schnauzer as well and she does GREAT with this food as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndee

customer_reviews.title: Stop feeding! Anal abscesses both dogs
customer_reviews.text: Get off the grain-free train! Been feeding this to two Siberians for 2 years+. BOTH have developed abscesses at the same time. The food is the only constant. Switch to a food that adds back in some brown rice. Dogs need fiber just like us. If your dogs have incurred abscesses whilst on this food I’d be interested in knowing about it.
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: Pea protein is not good for dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I stopped feeding my dogs this after I read an article about cardiac problems caused by protein derived from peas. Many grain free foods have pea protein. Dogs are not designed to eat legumes (and neither are humans, but that’s another topic.)
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick!
customer_reviews.text: This product made my dog sick after a few weeks of eating it. She had terrible diarrhea and would ask to go out multiple times a night. At first I thought she was in distress from the stress of moving, but when it didn’t go away I started investigating other options. We have switched back to her old food and she’s fine now.
customer_reviews.author: Allison White

customer_reviews.title: Better priced than box stores, great food for our lab.
customer_reviews.text: Our Red Fox Labrador has eaten Blue Buffalo since she was able to eat solid food as a puppy, she's now 4 and healthy as a horse, not over weight like those cheap foods can cause your dog to be, and she had great joints and teeth, a sign that this is quality food. The price is high, which scares people off, but it's better priced than the box stores, where it is often 53-63, so amazon saves us some money.
customer_reviews.author: Infidex

customer_reviews.title: Great Product Deliver To Your Door
customer_reviews.text: BW arrived about a half hour ago, delivered at my door. From the moment I put the bowl of BBW salmon down to the floor my female Getman Shepherd Dog tore into it, demolished more than half in a few minutes, saving the remainder for later. Delicious and Nutritious, who would know better than the dog, nuff said. ☆☆☆☆☆
customer_reviews.author: R. Sarno

customer_reviews.title: Horrible food
customer_reviews.text: If I could give a zero I would!! Used for over a year and has caused my dog stomach issues, if you want your dog to be sick and cause tons of medical bills this is the food for you!!
customer_reviews.author: mbmiller

customer_reviews.title: Do not feed this food to old and sedentary dogs
customer_reviews.text: I just want to warn owner of elderly dogs. My 14 year old dog loved the taste of this food, but it nearly killed her. The ultra high protein lead to kidney problems. Her bun score was 82. After one month off this food she is much better. Just be careful feeding this food to sedentary and older animals.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Wallace

product_meta.title: Blue Buffalo Wilderness High Protein, Natural Adult Dry Dog Food
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Salmon| Size:11 lbBLUE Wilderness natural dry dog food satisfies the spirit of the wolf in your canine with more of the meat dogs love. This high protein, grain free formula starts with delicious, protein-rich salmon, features antioxidant-rich LifeSource Bits and is enhanced with vitamins, minerals and other nutrients. Specially formulated for adult dogs, the high-quality protein plus complex carbohydrates from fruits and vegetables help support your dog’s energy needs.
feature_bullets: PACKED WITH REAL CHICKEN: A recipe made to satisfy your dog’s natural love for meat, this high protein dog food features real chicken to help build and maintain lean muscle mass

HEALTHY INGREDIENTS: BLUE Wilderness grain free dog food, made with healthy carbohydrates including sweet potatoes and peas, helps fuel your adult dog’s active lifestyle. It also contains omega 3 & 6 fatty acids to support skin and coat health

WITH LIFESOURCE BITS: This formula contains BLUE’s exclusive LifeSource Bits – a precise blend of antioxidants, vitamins and minerals to support immune system health, life stage requirements, and a healthy oxidative balance

NATURAL DOG FOOD: BLUE dry dog food features the finest natural ingredients enhanced with vitamins and minerals. It never contains chicken (or poultry) by-product meals, corn, wheat, soy, artificial flavors or preservatives
Contains one (1) 11-lb bag of BLUE Wilderness High Protein, Natural Adult Dry Dog Food, Salmon

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
